title: Drawing, Designs for Two Trophies: Stonecutters and Goldsmiths, 1780
title_raw: Designs for Two Trophies: Stonecutters and Goldsmiths
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, black chalk on white laid paper
markings: Verso, Cooper Union Museum, New York, stamp 457e
inscribed: In pen and brown ink, lower left: J. L. Delafosse; at upper right: 199; in the escutcheon below: le Lapidaire/et/L'orfevrerie
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Trophy at left, tools of mason, or stonecutter. Tablet shown with sun shining through clouds. Trophy at right, tools of goldsmiths. Tablet showing liturgical objects and a framed image of the sun, zodiac representations, and a circle drawn by a compass. In the escutcheon below is written: le lapidaire/ et/ l'orfevrerie.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Designs for Two Trophies: Stonecutters and Goldsmiths, 1780. Pen and black ink, brush and wash, black chalk on white laid paper. 
Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-301
